resources.string: Thank you very much for buying with us, you will receive the order in the next few days, have a good day

Although this is a very present dish on Christmas menus, nothing should prevent us from incorporating it into our celebrations at any other time of the year. It is an elegant and colorful starter that has everything to win the stomachs of our guests. Because it\'s de-li-cio-sa.

1/2 red cabbage 
 2 onions 
 1 pear 
 500 ml of homemade vegetable broth 
 200 ml of milk or liquid cream 
 3-4 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil 
 Salt 
 Raisins 
 Sprockets 
 Dill

1.Remove the hard trunk of the red cabbage and discard it. Cut the rest into thick julienne strips with the help of a sharp knife. We wash with plenty of cold water and drain. 

2.Peel the onions and cut them in half. Then we cut each half into quarters. 

3. Peel the pear, cut lengthwise, remove the seeds and cut into five or six pieces. 

4.Heat the oil in a fast pot, such as the WMF Perfect, add the onion and sauté for a couple of minutes. Add the red cabbage and the pear and fry for a couple more minutes.

5.Add the broth and season to taste (better to stay short and adjust the point at the end of cooking). We close the lid and heat over high heat. The moment the valve pops up, just the first line, we turn the heat down to medium low and count for eight minutes. \n
6. Once the cooking time has elapsed, we turn off the heat and let the pot depressurize itself. We open once all the steam has come out and the valve is hidden again. \n
7. Crush the cream with an arm mixer or with the help of a food processor. Add the liquid cream and beat again. We test and adjust the flavor point if we consider it necessary. \n
8 We serve in tureens and take to the table, decorating each portion with raisins, pine nuts and dill branches.
